basics.name: William Rice
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I served 12 years as a law enforcement officer, including management experience as a command staff level officer. My passion for technology extending beyond that as I've spent many years learning how to code and build software. I've worked on projects ranging from video game mods to web applications. I obtained an AAS in CIT - Programming from BCTC in 2022 as my passion for software grew and I became interested in switching careers. In early 2023, I began working part-time as a software developer alongside my law enforcement career. I made a decision to transition to full-time tech as a career in early 2024. As an already experienced developer, I've immediately contributed to many large projects at my company including being the lead developer on large-scale projects. I continue to grow and learn as a software developer as I'm always learning new programming languages and technologies as I broaden my skillset and keep up with new technologies as they evolve.

work.name: Joker Business Solutions
work.summary: Developed and maintained websites in Wordpress and ReactJS. Managed servers for hosting websites and email. Developed custom PHP wordpress plugins. Consulted and implemented AWS cloud services for clients.

work.name: Winchester Police Department
work.summary: Respond to emergency and non-emergency calls for service for the City of Winchester. Investigates crimes and apprehend suspects

work.name: Stanton Police Department
work.summary: Supervisor of the Criminal Investigation Divison for the City of Stanton. In addition to my supervisory role, I also investigated major crimes and acted as a firearm instructor for the department.

work.name: Richmond Police Department
work.summary: Responded to emergency and non-emergency calls for service for the City of Richmond. Investigated crimes and apprehended suspects.

volunteer.organization: Powell County Public Library Board of Trustees
volunteer.summary: An active member of the Powell County Public Library Board of Trustees serving as the board chair from 2023 - present.

Volunteer as a software developer to help contribute to Code4Community Lexington, which helps non-profits and other organizations with software solutions as well as develops open source software for the communities benefit.

projects.name: Gas Web Application
projects.description: Designed the infrastructure for and developed an enterprise application for a bow string manufacturing company to manage orders and calculate build parameters for the bow strings. The application is built in NextJS with typescript. The app utilizes the wordpress Rest API to communicate with the existing wordpress e-commerce platform.

projects.name: AWS Cryto Validator
projects.description: Consulted with client about various cryptography validator strategies and the technical and budget requirements to host each one. Developed and implemented an AWS solution for the client to host a crypto validator including a GUI for monitoring the nodes performance.

projects.name: ED Automate Voice Attack Plugin
projects.description: Developed an open source plugin for Voice Attack that allowed users to use voice control to scrape a webpage for data that was useful for the video game Elite Dangerous. The plugin was developed in C# and interfaced with Selenium for the web scraping and utilized the Voice Attack Plugin API to communicate. The plugin also had an automatic update service based on github releases. I no longer maintain the plugin due to lack of interest in video games and other interests.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: A personal website that I made while learning NextJS. I've built features into the website such as my own CRUD fuel tracker for when I worked at Winchester Police Dept and had a finite amount of gallons with no way to track it. I built a custom CMS so I can add projects to the website without editing the codebase. I implemented an API to upload/manage images in an s3 bucket and related them to the project database. I set up a VPS with coolify to self-host the website complete with CI/CD from the github repository.
